to judge people based on their success or failure (idiom)

definition: to get things done relying on others (idiom); with a little help from his friends
an unjust cause finds little support (idiom, from Mencius)/cf 得道多助[de2 dao4 duo1 zhu4] a just cause attracts much support
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
planning is with man, accomplishing with heaven (idiom); Man proposes but God disposes.

definition: A just cause attracts much support, an unjust one finds little (idiom, from Mencius)
